intro: Thalassia vitrariorum, commonly known as shoal grass, is a marine flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is a seagrass species that thrives in shallow, coastal waters, often forming dense underwater meadows. The plant has long, narrow leaves that are typically green and blade-like, adapted for efficient photosynthesis in aquatic environments. Its rhizomes spread horizontally, helping to stabilize sediments and provide habitat for various marine organisms. Thalassia vitrariorum plays a crucial role in coastal ecosystems by supporting biodiversity and maintaining water quality.
